alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 5:26PM CST until February 16 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Alabama, including the following counties, Colbert and Lauderdale. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM CST, Heavy rain has been ongoing in Colbert and Lauderdale Counties due to thunderstorms. At 512 PM, emergency management reported water over the road on Hwy 157 and County Rd. 57. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Florence, Cherokee, St. Florian, Underwood-Petersville, Oakland, Threet, Wright, Zip City, Mt Hester, Riverton, Margerum, Malone, Allsboro and Green Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
